review: This device has about the easiest and quickest installation procedure of any computer product I've encountered.  Unfortunately, I was never successful in getting it to work. In theory that should mean a one star rating. However, the lovely lady on the Google help line strove mightily for over an hour to resolve the problem which we both eventually concluded was due to an incompatibility with my router which, in fairness, is not listed on Google's list of known compatible equipment. Often, people at the other end of a help line (if you can even find a help line) are obviously reading from scripts, too often with an accent hard to decipher while giving the impression they want nothing more than to hurry you off the phone.  This person was was unfailingly polite, very knowledgeable, and clearly wanted to succeed in resolving my problem rather than hurrying to the next call to make some sort of quota.  And she was in Seattle, if you get my drift. That a company would devote such resources to trying to get a $35 device to work is more than impressive, it's unheard of.  So they get 4 stars for the effort with one subtracted for the unfortunate failure.  However, the vast majority of 5 star reviews for this device tell me my experience was an anomaly and that most folks will probably have an easy installation. The painless Amazon return policy I encountered after abandoning my attempts to install the Chromecast also make trying out this product a good risk.
